intro: Swainsona drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's swainsona, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Swainsona drummondii produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
